moves.7. Nde2: An uncommon reply, blocking the light bishop. Usually played is Nb3 or Nf3 here.
moves.7... Be6: Always being cautious to guard the hole on d5 in this opening.
moves.8. f4: Probably best, attacking my weak center pawns, and maybe aiming to exploit the hole on d5 by removing the defender (playing f5)
moves.9. f5: Probably best, still pressuring the center, harassing the bishop, and working towards exploiting the hole.
moves.9... Bc4 10. Qd2: Definately not white's best move here.. probably best is Ng3, forcing Bxf1 Rxf1, where white will castle long.
moves.10... d5: Taking control of the center, given the opportunity!
moves.11. exd5 Nxd5 12. O-O-O: A disaster.. White needed to play Nxd5 before castling!
moves.12... Bb4: Now the pin is devastating, as more pieces swarm around the white king.
moves.13. a3 Qa5: Bringing my queen into the growing attack, and exploiting the weakness of the white king.
moves.14. axb4: It's difficult to find the best move, probably Kb1 or even Qxd5 is best here.. white is in material trouble though.
moves.14... Ncxb4: Now the threats are everywhere and cannot be stopped.
